histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.InitialRttEsitmateSource
histogram.summary: The source for the initial RTT estimate recorded when a QUIC session is created.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.KeyUpdate.PerConnection
histogram.obsolete: Replaced 2020-10-22 with Net.QuicSession.KeyUpdate.PerConnection2 that is only logged for connections which supported key update.
histogram.summary: The number of key updates processed per connection, recorded on connection close. Only logged for connections which reached the 1-RTT level.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.KeyUpdate.PerConnection2
histogram.summary: The number of key updates processed per connection, recorded on connection close. Only logged for connections which reached the 1-RTT level and supported key update.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.KeyUpdate.PotentialPeerKeyUpdateAttemptCount
histogram.summary: Count of packets received that appeared to attempt a key update but failed decryption which have been received since the last successfully decrypted packet, recorded on connection close. Only logged for connections which reached the 1-RTT level and supported key update.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.KeyUpdate.Reason
histogram.summary: The reason why each key update occured.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.KeyUpdate.Success.{Group}
histogram.summary: Records the success or failure of the last key update for connections where the key update was initiated by the {Group} side. Failure is defined as having sent at least one packet in the new key phase but never receiving an ack for any packet sent in the new key phase before the connection was closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.KeyUpdate.Supported
histogram.summary: Whether key update was supported by either or both sides of the connection, recorded on connection close. Only logged for connections which reached the 1-RTT level.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.LastInFlightPacketSentTimeFromHandshakeCompletionWithPublicReset
histogram.summary: Time from handshake completion to last packet was sent for connections received PUBLIC_RESET.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.LastSentPacketContentBeforePublicReset
histogram.summary: A bitfield representing the last sent packet content before connection receives PUBLIC_RESET.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MaxConsecutiveRtoWithForwardProgress
histogram.summary: Max consecutive retransmission timeout before making forward progress.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MaxConsecutiveRtoWithForwardProgressAndBlackholeDetected
histogram.summary: Max consecutive retransmission timeout before making forward progress when blackhole has been detected.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MaxReordering
histogram.summary: The maximum packet sequence number reordering observed by a QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MaxReorderingTime
histogram.summary: The ratio of the maximum reordering time of a QUIC packet to the min rtt.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MaxReorderingTimeLongRtt
histogram.summary: The ratio of the maximum reordering time of a QUIC packet to the min rtt, only for those sessions with a min rtt larger than 100 ms.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MigrateToSocketSuccess
histogram.summary: Records whether the migration of the QuicSession to a new socket is successful.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MinRTT
histogram.summary: The minimum RTT observed during the life of a QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MtuProbesSent
histogram.summary: The number of MTU probes sent by the client during the session. Logged when the connection is destroyed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.NumActiveStreamsOnIdleTimeout
histogram.summary: The number of active streams when idle timeout is detected and connection is being closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.NumMigrations
histogram.summary: The number of successful migrations for a QUIC session.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.NumMigrationsExercisedBeforePublicReset
histogram.summary: Number of connection migrations exercised before the connection receives a public reset.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.NumOpenStreams
histogram.summary: The number of QUIC streams opened when a new QUIC stream is created.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.NumPendingStreamRequests
histogram.summary: The number of pending stream requests when a new stream request is added to the pending list. Pending streams are those which could not be created immediately because there were too many active streams.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.NumPingsSent
histogram.summary: The number of pings a QUIC connection sends during its lifetime.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.NumStreamsWaitingToWriteOnIdleTimeout
histogram.summary: The number of streams waiting to write when idle timeout is detected and connection is being closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.NumTotalStreams
histogram.summary: The total number of streams created by the client when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.OutOfOrderGapReceived
histogram.summary: The number of missing packets between the current received packet and the previously largest received packet sequence number, when the current received packet had a lower sequence number than the previously received packet sequence number.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.OutOfOrderLargePacketsReceived
histogram.summary: The number of times the current received packet had a lower sequence number than the previously received packet sequence number, and the size of the current packet is larger than the size of the previous packet.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.OutOfOrderPacketsReceived
histogram.summary: The number of times the current received packet had a lower sequence number than the previously received packet sequence number.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketGapReceived
histogram.summary: The number of missing packets between the current received packet and the previously largest received packet sequence number.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketGapReceivedNearPing
histogram.summary: The number of missing packets between the last received packet before a PING frame sent and the first packet received after PING sent.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketGapSent
histogram.summary: The number of missing packets between the current received packet and the previously largest received packet sequence number, as reported by the remote end of the connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketLossRate
histogram.summary: The ratio of the number of missing packets, to the maximum packet sequence number received, for QUIC connections longer than 21 packets received via

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketRetransmitsPerMille
histogram.summary: The number of packets retransmitted per 1000. Only sessions with packets_sent >= 100 are included. Recorded in session destructor.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketWriteTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to Write() a QUIC packet to the socket. Recorded for each packet when it is sent. The suffix specifies if the write completed synchonously or asynchronously.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PathValidationSuccess
histogram.summary: The result of path validation according to different migration causes.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PendingStreamsWaitTime
histogram.summary: The wait time of the pending stream when it is finally serviced. Pending streams are those which could not be created immediately because there were too many active streams.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PlatformNotification
histogram.summary: The platform notification received by QUIC when network change happens.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PortMigration
histogram.summary: The result of a QUIC port migration attempt.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PreferAesGcm
histogram.summary: True if the QUIC session prefers to use AES GCM because of hardware support.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ProbingRetryCountUntilSuccess
histogram.summary: Number of retries to send connectivity probing packet on new path until success.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ProbingTimeInMillisecondsUntilSuccess
histogram.summary: The wait time to receive a matched probing response to mark connectivity probing as successful.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PublicResetAddressMismatch2
histogram.summary: When a public reset packet is received, whether the client IP address and port number in it differ from the client IP address and port number in the ServerHello handshake message. In the comparison, the first address is the one in ServerHello and the second address is the one in public reset.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.Pushed
histogram.summary: The number of push streams received when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PushedAndClaimed
histogram.summary: The number of pushed and used streams when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PushedAndUnclaimedBytes
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that is pushed but not used when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PushedBytes
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that is pushed when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.Qpack.HeaderListCountWhenBlockedStreamLimited
histogram.summary: The ordinality of a header list within a connection during the encoding of which unacknowledged dynamic table entries could not be referenced due to the limit on the number of blocked streams.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.Qpack.HeaderListCountWhenInsertionBlocked
histogram.summary: The ordinality of a header list within a connection during the encoding of which at least one dynamic table insertion was blocked.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.Qpack.HeaderListCountWhenInsertionNotBlocked
histogram.summary: The ordinality of a header list within a connection during the encoding of which no dynamic table insertion was blocked.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.Qpack.HeaderListCountWhenNotBlockedStreamLimited
histogram.summary: The ordinality of a header list within a connection during the encoding of which the limit on the number of blocked streams did not prevent referencing unacknowledged dynamic table entries.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.QuicVersion
histogram.summary: Version of the QUIC protocol used for this connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ReadError
histogram.summary: The network error code returned when attempting to read from a QUIC connection. The suffix specifies the condition/source of the read error.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ReadError.CurrentNetwork.HandshakeConfirmed
histogram.summary: The network error code returned when attempting to read on the current network from a QUIC connection after handshake has been confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ReceivedSettings.BlockedStreams
histogram.summary: The value of the SETTINGS_QPACK_BLOCKED_STREAMS parameter received on an HTTP/3 connection, if any.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ReceivedSettings.CountPlusOne
histogram.summary: The number of SETTINGS parameters received on an HTTP/3 connection, incremented by one (the SETTINGS frame can be empty).

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ReceivedSettings.MaxHeaderListSize2
histogram.summary: The value of the SETTINGS_MAX_HEADER_LIST_SIZE parameter received on an HTTP/3 connection, if any.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ReceivedSettings.MaxTableCapacity2
histogram.summary: The value of the SETTINGS_QPACK_MAX_TABLE_CAPACITY parameter received on an HTTP/3 connection, if any.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ReceivedSettings.ReservedCountPlusOne
histogram.summary: The number of reserved SETTINGS parameters (that is, with identifier in the form 0x1f * N + 0x21 for a non-negative integer value of N) received on an HTTP/3 connection, incremented by one (there might be zero reserved identifiers). Defined at https://quicwg.org/base-drafts/draft-ietf-quic-http.html#name-defined-settings-parameters. These should not be treated specially on the receive side, because they are sent to exercise the requirement that unknown identifiers are ignored. Here an exception is made for logging only, to understand what kind of identifiers are received.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.RejectHasProof
histogram.summary: True if the QUIC REJ message received from the server contains a proof.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.RejectLength
histogram.summary: The length in bytes of a QUIC REJ message received from the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.RetryAfterWriteErrorCount2
histogram.summary: The number of consecutive times a packet was retried after a write error, using exponential backoff.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.RstStreamErrorCodeClient
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code which resulted in a stream being reset by the client.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.RstStreamErrorCodeServer
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code which resulted in a stream being reset by the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.SecureResourceSecureSession
histogram.summary: The number of request for secure resources over QUIC sessions. True if the session is secure, false if it is not.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.SelfShloAddressMismatch
histogram.summary: When a SHLO handshake message is received, whether the client IP address and port number in it differ from the local client IP address and port number. In the comparison, the first address is the one in SHLO and the second address is the client IP address.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.SendPacketSize
histogram.summary: The size in bytes of an encrypted QUIC packet sent to the peer at the specified encryption level.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ServerSideMtu
histogram.summary: The largest packet which the client received from the server during the session.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.SmoothedRTT
histogram.summary: The final smoothed RTT observed during the life of a QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StaleAndFreshHostMatched
histogram.summary: True if fresh host lists contains stale host used in racing connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StaleConnectionTime
histogram.summary: The time a QUIC connection from invalid stale dns result takes to do Crypto handshake. This starts on DoConnect and ends when the connection finishes.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StaleHostRacing
histogram.summary: True if the stale host is used in racing connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StatelessResetAfterProbingCancelled
histogram.summary: Records when a STATELESS_RESET is received after a connectivity probing is cancelled.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StatelessResetDuringProbing
histogram.summary: When probing is cancelled, records whether a STATELESS_RESET is received.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StopSendingErrorCodeClient
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code that we sent in a STOP_SENDING frame.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StopSendingErrorCodeServer
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code that we received in a STOP_SENDING frame.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamCloseErrorCodeClient.HandshakeConfirmed
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code which resulted in the stream (and connection) being closed by the client after the handshake was confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamCloseErrorCodeServer.HandshakeConfirmed
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code which resulted in the stream (and connection) being closed by the client after the handshake was confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamFlowControlBlocked
histogram.summary: Whether any of QUIC session's streams are flow control blocked when a PING message is sent to server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamFrameDuplicatedLongConnection
histogram.summary: The number of stream frames received which were duplicates, out of every 1000 stream frames received. Only for QUIC sessions which received at least 100 packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamFrameDuplicatedPercentLongConnection
histogram.summary: The percentage of stream frames received which were duplicates. Only for QUIC sessions which received at least 100 packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamFrameDuplicatedPercentShortConnection
histogram.summary: The percentage of stream frames received which were duplicates. Only for QUIC sessions which received fewer than 100 packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamFrameDuplicatedShortConnection
histogram.summary: The number of stream frames received which were duplicates, out of every 1000 stream frames received. Only for QUIC sessions which received fewer than 100 packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TimedOutWithOpenStreams.ConsecutiveRTOCount
histogram.summary: If a QUIC connection timed out with open streams, this contains a count of consecutive RTOs.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TimedOutWithOpenStreams.ConsecutiveTLPCount
histogram.summary: If a QUIC connection timed out with open streams, this contains a count of consecutive TLPs.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TimedOutWithOpenStreams.HasUnackedPackets
histogram.summary: If a QUIC connection timed out with open streams, this will be true when the connection has unacked packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TimedOutWithOpenStreams.LocalPort
histogram.summary: If a QUIC connection timed out locally with open streams, this contains the local port number for the connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TimeFromResolveHostToConfirmConnection
histogram.summary: The time a QuicStreamFactory Job takes from host rersolution to connection confirmation.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TooManyOpenStreams
histogram.summary: True if more than 100 streams are open when a new stream is activated.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TooSmallInitialSentPacket
histogram.summary: When a QUIC packet is sent at initial encryption that is smaller than the minimum size, this records the size difference (minimum_size - observed_size).

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.UndecryptablePacketsReceived
histogram.summary: The number of undecryptable packets recevied by a QuicSession when the session is closed. Includes packets where a decryption key was not present.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.UndecryptablePacketsReceivedWithDecrypter
histogram.summary: The number of undecryptable packets recevied by a QuicSession when the session is closed. Only includes packets where a decryption key was present for the packet's encryption level.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.UnexpectedNotGoingAway
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was removed in Feb 2021, because the corresponded crash has been fixed.
histogram.summary: The location in quic_client_session.cc where a session is unexpectedly not going away.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.UnexpectedObservers
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was removed in Feb 2021, because the corresponded crash has been fixed.
histogram.summary: The location in quic_client_session.cc where there were unexpected observers.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.UnexpectedOpenStreams
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was removed in Feb 2021, because the corresponded crash has been fixed.
histogram.summary: The location in quic_client_session.cc where there were unexpected open streams.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ValidConnectionTime
histogram.summary: The time a QUIC connection that will be confirmed takes for Crypto handshake. The event starts on DoConnect, and ends when the connection finishes.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.VerifyProofTime
histogram.summary: Time spent verifying the signature and certificate chain. This is logged whenever QUIC verifies the certificate chain and signature during crypto handshake.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.WriteError
histogram.summary: The network error code returned when attempting to write to a QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.WriteError.HandshakeConfirmed
histogram.summary: The network error code returned when attempting to write to a QUIC connection after the handshake has been confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.WriteError.NetworkDisconnected
histogram.summary: The most recent network error code when attempting to write to a QUIC connection when the network gets disconnected.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.WritePacketNotReusableReason
histogram.summary: The reason QUIC packet writer needed to allocate a new buffer, rather than the expected case of reusing its existing one.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ZeroRttReason
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a QUIC handshake attempted or used 0-RTT on the connection, and if 0-RTT was not used, it provides reasons why.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ZeroRttReasonGoogle
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a QUIC handshake attempted or used 0-RTT on the connection, and if 0-RTT was not used, it provides reasons why. Only records connections with Google hosted servers.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ZeroRttReasonNonGoogle
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a QUIC handshake attempted or used 0-RTT on the connection, and if 0-RTT was not used, it provides reasons why. Only records connections with non-Google servers.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ZeroRttState
histogram.summary: Whether 0-RTT was successfully used in the connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.AttemptMigrationBeforeHandshake
histogram.summary: Records if a new connection on the alternate network is attempted when a connection fails before handshake is confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.AttemptMigrationBeforeHandshake.FailedConnectionType
histogram.summary: Connection type of the default network when the connection fails with handshake not confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.BadPacketLossEvents5
histogram.summary: A count of how often a user hits 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 bad packet loss events for port 443. Recorded whenever QUIC has bad packet loss (high packet loss on multiple consecutive connections).

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.ConnectionOnNonDefaultNetwork
histogram.summary: Status of the connection on the non-default network when it finishes. A connection may stay on the non-default network during the initial setup when the platform's default network changes.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.DefaultNetworkMatch
histogram.summary: Records, for initial socket created for each new QUIC connection, whether the bound network matched the default network tracked by QuicStreamFactory.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.DisabledReasons
histogram.summary: Rrecords reasons QUIC is disabled (for all ports), if sufficent recent connections experience: public reset post crypto handshake, or timeouts with streams open. QUIC is disabled until the next reboot of Chrome. Logged during session close.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.DoConnectFailureLocation
histogram.summary: Log the location in QuicStreamFactory where QUIC_PROTOCOL_ERROR is reported.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.MigrationBeforeHandshake.NewConnectionType
histogram.summary: Connection type of the alternate network when a connection is about to be attempted when the original connection fails on the default network with handshake not confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.MigrationBeforeHandshake2
histogram.summary: Status of the connection which is created for migration before handshake is confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.MigrationBeforeHandshakeFailedReason
histogram.summary: The network error code returned when the retried connection on the alternate network before handshake fails.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.NetworkChangeDuringMigrationBeforeHandshake
histogram.summary: Captures whether the default network has been changed when the new connection succeeds on the "alternate" network.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.PublicResetsPostHandshake
histogram.summary: Captures the maximum number of public resets post handshake that occurred within a window of recent connections (default 20). Will help inform the choice of threshold to disable QUIC for clients that experience pathalogical errors. Logged during session close.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.QuicIsDisabled
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever QUIC is disabled for a port due to repeated lossy connections (high packet loss on multiple consecutive connections). QUIC is disabled until next reboot of Chrome.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.TimeoutsWithOpenStreams
histogram.summary: Captures the maximum number of connection timeouts with streams open that occurred within a window of recent connections (default 20). Will help inform the choice of threshold to disable QUIC for clients that experience pathalogical errors. Logged during session close.

histogram.name: Net.QuicTransportClient.ConnectionCloseCodeClient
histogram.summary: The Google QUIC error code which resulted in the QuicTransport connection being closed by the client.

histogram.name: Net.QuicTransportClient.ConnectionCloseCodeServer
histogram.summary: The Google QUIC error code which resulted in the QuicTransport connection being closed by the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicTransportClient.ConnectionError
histogram.summary: The error code for cases when QuicTransport failed to establish a connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicTransportClient.Error
histogram.summary: The code for QuicTransport errors.

histogram.name: Net.QuicTransportClient.FailedAtConnectState
histogram.summary: The state at which establishing a QuicTransport connection has failed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicTransportClient.FailedAtState
histogram.summary: The state at which the QuicTransportClient has been marked as failed.

histogram.name: Net.RedirectChainLength
histogram.summary: The total number of redirects encountered during processing a URLRequest. This includes redirects generated by servers (for example, 302 Found) and redirects generated internally (for example, HSTS redirects or error pages).

histogram.name: Net.RedirectWithUnadvertisedContentEncoding
histogram.summary: True for redirect responses with unadvertised "Content-Encoding". False for valid redirect responses. See http://crbug.com/714514

histogram.name: Net.Reporting.HeaderType
histogram.summary: The type of header received for configuring reporting API endpoints, recorded when reporting API headers are successfully parsed.

histogram.name: Net.Reporting.ReportOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of Reporting trying to deliver a report, recorded when the report is finally erased from memory.

histogram.name: Net.Reporting.UploadHeaderType
histogram.summary: The type of header that produced the endpoint used for uploading reports for the Reporting API, recorded when reports have been succesfully uploaded, counted once for each report.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceLoader.ReadDeferral
histogram.summary: When starting a cross-site navigation, the time between reading the headers and body of the response.

histogram.name: Net.RestrictedCookieManager.CookiePartitionKeyOK
histogram.summary: Logged whenever a partitioned cookie is set from a renderer process, which can be from either document.cookie or the CookieStore API. True if the partition key was set with the FromScript constructor (used by the CookieStore API) or if the partition key matches the RestrictedCookieManager's internal partition key (which is the case for cookies set/modified by document.cookie).

histogram.name: Net.RestrictedCookieManager.SiteForCookiesOK
histogram.summary: Logged on any document.cookie or CookieStore API operation. True if the browser-side site_for_cookies and the render-provided value match.

histogram.name: Net.RestrictedCookieManager.TopFrameOriginOK
histogram.summary: Logged on any document.cookie or CookieStore API operation. True if the browser-side top_frame_origin and the render-provided value match.

histogram.name: Net.SameSiteBlockedCookieSiteEngagement.CookieInsecureAndSameSiteNone
histogram.summary: The site engagement level of a frame that triggers the CookieInsecureAndSameSiteNone warning, whether the cookie was actually blocked or not. Recorded every time one or more cookies triggers the warning.

histogram.name: Net.SameSiteBlockedCookieSiteEngagement.CookieNoSameSite
histogram.summary: The site engagement level of a frame that triggers the CookieNoSameSite warning, whether the cookie was actually blocked or not. Recorded every time one or more cookies triggers the warning.

histogram.name: Net.SiteDomainIsSafe
histogram.summary: Whether the origin passed to SchemefulSite's constructor is safe or not. "Unsafe" sites have an eTLD+1 that is not a canonical hostname. e.g., "http://foo.127.1/" has an eTLD+1 of "127.1", but the canonical form of "http://127.1" is "http://127.0.0.1". Logged for all origins with network hosts (http, https, ws, etc). See https://crbug.com/1157010.

histogram.name: Net.SocketUnchangeableReceiveBuffer
histogram.summary: The size of a socket's receive buffer when the attempt to change it via setsockopt failed.

histogram.name: Net.SocketUnchangeableSendBuffer
histogram.summary: The size of a socket's send buffer when the attempt to change it via setsockopt failed.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyFrameStreamAndSessionFlowControlState
histogram.summary: The counts of the flow control state of each frame (with stream and session flow control on).

histogram.name: Net.SpdyHeadersCompressionPercentage
histogram.summary: The percent compression achieved when compressing HEADERS frames.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyHpackDecompressionPercentage
histogram.summary: The compression percentage in received HPACK compressed header frames.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyIPPoolDomainMatch
histogram.summary: Status of checking if a SPDY domain can handle a IP match. If a match is found, we successfully used the IP Pooling. If a match is not found, we could have used IP Pooling, except the TLS Cert didn't match the IP-pooled domain.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyPushedStreamFate
histogram.summary: This histogram is recorded exactly once for every PUSH_PROMISE frame received on an HTTP/2 connection, and tracks the fate of the pushed stream.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyResponseCode
histogram.summary: HTTP status codes received in HTTP/2 HEADERS frames. If a stream contains one or more informational (1xx) response preceeding the main response, each status code is logged separately.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.AcceptChForOrigin
histogram.summary: Records whether the HTTP/2 session received an Accept-CH entry for the given origin, which GetAcceptChViaAlps() returns. Logged every time SpdyHttpStream::GetAcceptChViaAlps() is called, typically once for each request that is served over HTTP/2.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.AlpsAcceptChEntries
histogram.summary: Records both whether there are any valid origin fields and whether there are any invalid ones in ACCEPT_CH frames. Logged once for each TLS handshake of a HTTP/2 connection if ALPS is negotiated, regardless of the number of ACCEPT_CH frames received in ALPS.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.AlpsDecoderStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status (OK or error code) returned by AlpsDecoder when parsing ALPS data. Logged once for each TLS handshake of a HTTP/2 connection if ALPS is negotiated.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.AlpsSettingParameterCount
histogram.summary: Records the total number of setting parameters received in SETTINGS frames in ALPS. Logged once for each TLS handshake of a HTTP/2 connection if ALPS is negotiated, regardless of the number of SETTINGS frames received in ALPS.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.ClosedOnError
histogram.summary: Net error codes when SpdySession was closed.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.CreateStreamWithSocketConnected
histogram.summary: Socket connected status in SpdySession::CreateStream.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.GoAwayReceived
histogram.summary: Records the error code value received in each HTTP/2 GOAWAY frame.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.PushedAndUnclaimedBytes
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that is pushed but not used when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.PushedBytes
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that is pushed when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.ServerSupportsWebSocket
histogram.summary: Whether the server has advertised support for WebSockets over HTTP/2.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionErrorDetails2
histogram.summary: The type of SPDY Protocol error encountered.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionErrorDetails_Google2
histogram.summary:
WARNING: r181910 added an enum value in the middle, so don't trust the counts for values 9 and above for Chrome builds after that revision.
The type of SPDY Protocol error encountered when talking to a google.com server.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionGet
histogram.summary: The type of SPDY Session used when looking up a session.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionGetPeerAddressNotConnected
histogram.summary: Whether SpdySession::Get{Peer,Local}Address was called when the connection had no socket.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamsAbandonedPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of pushed, but abandoned streams over a single session.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamsPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of streams issued over a single session.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamsPushedAndClaimedPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of pushed, and used streams over a single session.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamsPushedPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of push streams received over a single session.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_CipherSuite
histogram.summary: The SSL/TLS cipher suite that was negotiated. Recorded for each SSL/TLS connection in the socket pool where Connect() succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Error
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned when opening an SSL connection.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Error_TLS13Experiment
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned when opening an SSL connection for an endpoint we are using in the initial TLS 1.3 deployment.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_2
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_TLS13Experiment
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for a set of domains that we are using in the initial TLS 1.3 deployment.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_KeyExchange.ECDHE
histogram.summary: The curve used for key exchange for ECDHE. Recorded for each SSL/TLS connection in the socket pool where Connect() succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.SSLCertVerificationTime
histogram.summary: Time to complete a certificate verification (success case).

histogram.name: Net.SSLCertVerificationTimeError
histogram.summary: Time to complete a certificate verification (error case).

histogram.name: Net.SSLHandshakeDetails
histogram.summary: For each successful TLS handshake, what kind of handshake was used. This metric distinguishes TLS 1.2 (or earlier) and TLS 1.3 as they have very different resumption and round-trip behaviors. It also distinguishes full handshakes, resumption, 0-RTT, and False Start.

histogram.name: Net.SSLHandshakeEarlyDataReason
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a TLS 1.3 connection ended up using 0-RTT or not, and why; this includes reasons such as the server declining to resume the connection and the client not having enough tickets available. This metric is only recorded if 0-RTT supported is enabled in the client.

histogram.name: Net.SSLHandshakeEarlyDataReason.Google
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a TLS 1.3 connection to a Google host ended up using 0-RTT or not, and why; this includes reasons such as the server declining to resume the connection and the client not having enough tickets available. This metric is only recorded if 0-RTT supported is enabled in the client.

histogram.name: Net.SSLKeyLogFileUse
histogram.summary: Counts when the SSLKEYLOGFILE environment variable or --ssl-key-log-file command-line flag are set, and when they enable the SSLKeyLogger feature.

histogram.name: Net.SSLLegacyCryptoFallback
histogram.summary: For each TLS connection, whether it needed the legacy crypto fallback and a classification as to why. See https://crbug.com/658905 and https://crbug.com/691888. Note some connections are reported as sending SHA-1 certificates because, although SHA-1 is no longer accepted in certificates, servers may send unused certificates in the handshake. Some such servers additionally match their certificate chains against the ClientHello. These servers require the client advertise legacy algorithms despite not actually using them.

histogram.name: Net.SSLNegotiatedAlpnProtocol
histogram.summary: For each TLS handshake, whether ALPN was negotiated; and if so, the negotiated protocol.

histogram.name: Net.SSLRSAKeyUsage.UnknownRoot
histogram.summary: For each TLS connection which uses a unknown root, an RSA key, and TLS 1.2 or below, what the result of checking the RSA key usage would have been.

histogram.name: Net.SSLSignatureAlgorithm
histogram.summary: For each SSL connection with a full handshake using a DHE- or ECDHE-based key exchange, the signature algorithm used to authenticate the peer. In TLS 1.2, this is the signature on the ServerKeyExchange message. (Note: Although the ECDSA values specify a curve, the curve is only enforced in TLS 1.3.)

histogram.name: Net.SSLVersion
histogram.summary: The SSL/TLS version that was negotiated. Recorded for each SSL/TLS connection in the socket pool where Connect() succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.SSLVersionGoogle
histogram.summary: The SSL/TLS version that was negotiated to a Google host. Recorded for each appplicable SSL/TLS connection in the socket pool where Connect() succeeds. Google servers all support TLS 1.2, so any occurrences of TLS 1.0 or TLS 1.1 indicate an outdated insecure TLS MITM proxy, such as some antivirus configurations. TLS 1.0 and 1.1 are deprecated, so record these to see how prevalent they are. See https://crbug.com/896013.

histogram.name: Net.TCP_Connection_Latency
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes. Only times under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.TCP_Connection_Latency_IPv4_No_Race
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes when the network address only contains IPv4 addresses. Only times under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.TCP_Connection_Latency_IPv4_Wins_Race
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes when the IPv4 fallback connection won the race against IPv6. Only times under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.TCP_Connection_Latency_IPv6_Raceable
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes when we race an IPv6 connection against an IPv4 connection with a 300ms delay. Only times under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.TCP_Connection_Latency_IPv6_Solo
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes when the network address only contains IPv6 addresses. Only times under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.TcpConnectAttempt.Latency.Error
histogram.summary: Time taken when failed to establish a TCP connection to an individual endpoint. This includes the case when the attempt was aborted by a higher layer (likely because it took too long).

histogram.name: Net.TcpConnectAttempt.Latency.Success
histogram.summary: Time taken to successfully establish a TCP connection to an individual endpoint.

histogram.name: Net.TcpConnectAttempt.LatencyPercentRTT.Error
histogram.summary: Time taken when failed to establish a TCP connection to an individual endpoint, expressed as a multiple of the transport RTT. This includes the case when the attempt was aborted by a higher layer (likely because it took too long). This may have fewer samples than Net.TcpConnectAttempt.Latency.* in cases where the network quality estimation was unknown.

histogram.name: Net.TcpConnectAttempt.LatencyPercentRTT.Success
histogram.summary: Time taken to successfully establish a TCP connection to an individual endpoint, expressed as a multiple of the transport RTT. This may have fewer samples than Net.TcpConnectAttempt.Latency.* in cases where the network quality estimation was unknown.

histogram.name: Net.TcpRtt.AtDisconnect
histogram.summary: The kernel's estimated TCP round trip time. Recorded for each TCP socket, at the time it is disconnected.

histogram.name: Net.TrustTokens.FetchFailedReason
histogram.obsolete: This was a temporary addition used for debugging during M88.
histogram.summary: A descriptive reason why a Fetch API call with an associated Trust Tokens operation failed. This might help debug a surfeit of 'TypeError: failed to fetch' observed in live testing.

histogram.name: Net.TrustTokens.IssuanceHelperLocalFulfillResult
histogram.summary: For locally diverted platform-provided trust token issuance requests, the results of the LocalOperationDelegate issuance delegation call. This is a liveness metric that allows verifying that platform-provided trust token issuance is working during the feature's initial rollout (and, if it isn't, that helps debug the failures).

histogram.name: Net.TrustTokens.NetErrorForFetchFailure
histogram.summary: The net error for a failed Fetch API call with an associated Trust Tokens operation. This was originally added to help debug a surfeit of 'TypeError: failed to fetch' observed in live testing, and it is now retained since it's useful for ongoing health monitoring.

histogram.name: Net.TrustTokens.NetErrorForTrustTokenOperation
histogram.summary: The //net status codes for resource requests that had started Trust Tokens operations. This captures the reasons why requests with Trust Tokens operations fail and might help debug a surfeit of "TypeError: failed to fetch" observed in live testing.

histogram.name: Net.TrustTokens.Operation{TimeSpan}Time.{Outcome}.{Type}{OptionalPlatformProvided}
histogram.summary:
Time taken to execute various parts of a Trust Tokens operation: 1. Begin = time taken to execute the operation's outbound Begin half 2. Server = time from the end of the outbound Begin half to the beginning of the inbound Finalize half 3. Finalize = time taken to execute the inbound Finalize half 4. Total = Begin + Server + Finalize (only recorded for operations that see server responses)
The other variants (see histogram_suffixes_list's TrustTokenOperationType entry): 1. Outcome (Success or Failure) 2. The type of Trust Tokens operation 3. Whether the operation was platform-provided (i.e. executed by a method other than a direct HTTP request to the issuer's server)

histogram.name: Net.TrustTokens.RedemptionRequestEmpty
histogram.summary: Whether the Trust Tokens redemption logic received an empty redemption request string from its underlying cryptographic library. If this is always true, but servers occasionally see empty redemption request headers, it might suggest middleware (namely extensions) is removing the headers' values.

histogram.name: Net.TrustTokens.RequestHelperFactoryOutcome
histogram.summary: For resource requests that bear Trust Tokens parameters, the results of running TrustTokenRequestHelperFactory to initialize Trust Tokens handling logic. This might help debug a surfeit of failed Trust Tokens issuance operations observed in live testing.

histogram.name: Net.TrustTokens.SubresourceOperationRequiringFeaturePolicy.PolicyIsConsistentWithBrowserOpinion
histogram.summary: For a Trust Tokens operation associated with a subresource request, stores whether the browser believed the frame had the Feature Policy feature necessary for executing the operation.

histogram.name: Net.UdpSocketRandomBindErrorCode
histogram.summary: Chromium error code from call to RandomBind() UDP socket.

histogram.name: Net.UDPSocketWinClose
histogram.summary: The time spent in closesocket call in UDPSocketWin::Close.

histogram.name: Net.Url.HostSafetyStatus
histogram.summary: Logged each time url/ canonicalizes a hostname with a numeric TLD that's not an IPv4 hostname. Unlike other histograms that record HostSafetyStatus, this one does not record the OK bucket, since it's both not terribly meaningful and URLs are canonicalized so frequently.

histogram.name: Net.URLLoaderThrottleDeferTime.WillProcessResponse.{Throttle}
histogram.summary: Measures time {Throttle} deferred a request on WillProcessResponse. Logged every time {Throttle} defers a request.

histogram.name: Net.URLLoaderThrottleDeferTime.WillStartRequest.{Throttle}
histogram.summary: Measures time {Throttle} deferred a request on WillStartRequest. Logged every time {Throttle} defers a request.

histogram.name: Net.URLLoaderThrottleDeferTime.{Stage}
histogram.summary: Measures time a URLLoaderThrottle was deferred when on {Stage}. Logged every time a throttle defers a request.

histogram.name: Net.URLLoaderThrottleExecutionTime.{Stage}
histogram.summary: Measures time a URLLoaderThrottle took to execute {Stage}. Logged every time a throttle runs.

histogram.name: Net.URLRequest.ReferrerHasInformativePath
histogram.summary: Records for each URLRequest whether its referrer contains more information than just its origin (this is the case exactly when it has at least one character apart from a leading slash in its path, e.g. http://example.com/a but not http://example.com/ nor http://example.com).

histogram.name: Net.URLRequest.ReferrerPolicyForRequest
histogram.summary: Records the distribution of referrer policies provided with outgoing URLRequests, and whether or not the requests were cross-origin.

histogram.name: Net.URLRequest.ReferrerPolicyHeaderPresentOnRedirect
histogram.summary: Records the usage of the Referrer-Policy header on redirect responses. This histogram is recorded on each HTTP redirect response, with the value true if a Referrer-Policy header was present and false otherwise.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.CloseCode
histogram.summary: Records the status code with which WebSockets are closed. Logged once for every successfully opened WebSocket. Includes codes "No Status Rcvd" and "Abnormal Closure" which are never sent over the wire but generated internally. See RFC6455 section 7.4.1 for the meanings of the codes. Newer codes are documented at https://www.iana.org/assignments/websocket/websocket.xhtml#close-code-number. Codes that have not been standardised are bucketed to save storage space. Used to determine if changes in framing change the error rate.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.ErrorCodes
histogram.summary: Positive net error codes that WebSockets end with, including OK and ABORTED.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.HandshakeResult2
histogram.summary: Results of WebSocket handshakes, including information whether the handshake happened over HTTP/2. Use this histogram as a baseline for investigating feature usage counters.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: All HTTP status codes seen during WebSocket handshakes.
